record.description: Electron micrograph of a thin [segment from the] eye of the South American moth Erebus ordora. The ordered, symmetrical fine structure of its constituents plays a key role in the remarkable capacity for analyzing polarized light and the direction-finding ability of insects. Magnification x 6000.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Part of caption missing. Thin, translucent covering taped over the photo (has markings for UC Mag to crop) cannot remove tape without tearing photo. See also April/May 1969 issue U of C magazine. Photos taken (possibly) by H. Fernandez-Moran for his monograph on experiments using electron microscopy. UC Mag stamp, mounted on board.
